snippet: The ethnic Russian mayor of Riga, Nils Usakovs, says he hopes to put ethnic politics in the past, but the crisis in Ukraine is not helping.
abstract: Saturday Profile of Nils Usakovs, first ethnic Russian to be elected mayor of Riga, Latvia; immediately upon assuming office, Usakovs announced plans to change focus of his party, Harmony Center, from rights of ethnic Russian minority to socially democratic organization like others of its kind across Europe; says that in long run Latvia's politics must be based on ideological values and not solely on ethnicity.
lead_paragraph: The ethnic Russian mayor of Riga, Nils Usakovs, says he hopes to put ethnic politics in the past, but the crisis in Ukraine is not helping.

headline.seo: Nils Usakovs, Mayor of Riga, Aims to Move Beyond Ethnic Politics
headline.main: Mayor of Latvian Capital Tries to Bridge Old Divide
headline.print_headline: Mayor of Latvian Capital Tries to Bridge Old Divide
